dataset.title: Data for Schuldt et al. 2015 "Multitrophic diversity in a biodiverse forest is highly nonlinear across spatial scales" (Nature Communitcations)

creator.organizationName: German Centre for Integrative Biodiversity Research (iDiv), Leipzig
Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research UFZ Leipzig-Halle, Department of Soil Ecology
University of Freiburg, Chair of Nature Conservation and Landscape Ecology
Institute of Botany / Geobotany and Botanical Garden Martin Luther University Halle-Wittenberg

abstract.para: This dataset accompanies the paper by Schuldt et al. "Diversity relations across trophic levels change with spatial scale in a biodiverse forest"

keywordSet.keywordThesaurus: Find the list of keywords here: http://china.befdata.biow.uni-leipzig.de/keywords
List of headers of the data columns in this dataset

intellectualRights.para: Please contact Andreas Schuldt for usage permission

description.para: Data for Schuldt et al. 2015 "Multitrophic diversity in a biodiverse forest is highly nonlinear across spatial scales" (Nature Communitcations)
This dataset accompanies the paper by Schuldt et al. "Diversity relations across trophic levels change with spatial scale in a biodiverse forest"
Comparative Study Plots

samplingDescription.para: Organism data for the 27 Comparative Study Plots in the Gutianshan National Nature Reserve. Details on sampling can be found in the Schuldt et al. Paper

dataTable.entityDescription: Data for Schuldt et al. 2015 "Multitrophic diversity in a biodiverse forest is highly nonlinear across spatial scales" (Nature Communitcations)

attribute.attributeDefinition: The scientific species fullnames are based on the "Flora of China" identified by Teng Fang and verified by Helge Bruelheide (trees) and Alexandra Erfmeier (herbs). Scientific species names consist of epithet and genus. For identification, the Author name and the year of the publications of the description are required. (Plant species: Plant species)

textDomain.definition: The scientific species fullnames are based on the "Flora of China" identified by Teng Fang and verified by Helge Bruelheide (trees) and Alexandra Erfmeier (herbs). Scientific species names consist of epithet and genus. For identification, the Author name and the year of the publications of the description are required.

description.para: Scientific plant species name

The scientific species fullnames are based on the "Flora of China" identified by Teng Fang and verified by Helge Bruelheide (trees) and Alexandra Erfmeier (herbs). Scientific species names consist of epithet and genus. For identification, the Author name and the year of the publications of the description are required.
Plant species

attribute.attributeDefinition: Species or morphospecies from the phylum Arthropoda. This datagroup should only be used if cases in which it is not feasible to differentiate between different lower taxonomic levels. (Arthropod species: Arthropod species identified along the comparative study plot. Here some species are given as morphospecies as the analysis was not dependent on detailed taxonomic information.)

textDomain.definition: Species or morphospecies from the phylum Arthropoda. This datagroup should only be used if cases in which it is not feasible to differentiate between different lower taxonomic levels.

description.para: Arthropod species
Species or morphospecies from the phylum Arthropoda. This datagroup should only be used if cases in which it is not feasible to differentiate between different lower taxonomic levels.
Arthropod species identified along the comparative study plot. Here some species are given as morphospecies as the analysis was not dependent on detailed taxonomic information.

attribute.attributeDefinition: In phylogeny an operational taxonomic unit (OTU) is an operational definition of a species or group of species often used when only DNA sequence data is available. It is the most commonly used microbial diversity unit. The definition given by NCBI is: "Taxonomic level of sampling selected by the user to be used in a study, such as individuals, populations, species, genera, or bacterial strains." Another definition: "Operational taxonomic unit, species distinction in microbiology. Typically using rRNA and a percent similarity threshold for classifying microbes within the same, or different, OTUs" (Wikipedia entry) (Operational Taxonomic Unit: Operational Taxonomic Unit corresponding to microfauna)

textDomain.definition: In phylogeny an operational taxonomic unit (OTU) is an operational definition of a species or group of species often used when only DNA sequence data is available. It is the most commonly used microbial diversity unit. The definition given by NCBI is: "Taxonomic level of sampling selected by the user to be used in a study, such as individuals, populations, species, genera, or bacterial strains." Another definition: "Operational taxonomic unit, species distinction in microbiology. Typically using rRNA and a percent similarity threshold for classifying microbes within the same, or different, OTUs" (Wikipedia entry)

description.para: Operational taxonomic unit (OTU)

In phylogeny an operational taxonomic unit (OTU) is an operational definition of a species or group of species often used when only DNA sequence data is available. It is the most commonly used microbial diversity unit. The definition given by NCBI is: "Taxonomic level of sampling selected by the user to be used in a study, such as individuals, populations, species, genera, or bacterial strains." Another definition: "Operational taxonomic unit, species distinction in microbiology. Typically using rRNA and a percent similarity threshold for classifying microbes within the same, or different, OTUs" (Wikipedia entry)
Operational Taxonomic Unit corresponding to microfauna

attribute.attributeDefinition: Nominal taxon which has been assigned to a species(group). This does not reflect a real taxonomic instance but allows to differentiate certain taxonomic and/or functional instances across analyses that do not rely on detailed taxonomy. ((Morpho)species_or_OTU: Name code of (morpho)species or operational taxonomic unit (OTU). Nominal assignment to a group that can be used as a grouping factor for analyses on abundance across the Gutianshan study plots.)

textDomain.definition: Nominal taxon which has been assigned to a species(group). This does not reflect a real taxonomic instance but allows to differentiate certain taxonomic and/or functional instances across analyses that do not rely on detailed taxonomy.

description.para: Nominal taxon

Nominal taxon which has been assigned to a species(group). This does not reflect a real taxonomic instance but allows to differentiate certain taxonomic and/or functional instances across analyses that do not rely on detailed taxonomy.
Name code of (morpho)species or operational taxonomic unit (OTU). Nominal assignment to a group that can be used as a grouping factor for analyses on abundance across the Gutianshan study plots.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Nominal taxon which has been assigned to a species(group). This does not reflect a real taxonomic instance but allows to differentiate certain taxonomic and/or functional instances across analyses that do not rely on detailed taxonomy. (Taxon: Higher taxonomic unit the (morpho)species or OTU belongs to. Moreover, detailed information on feeding preferences or similar are given.)

textDomain.definition: Nominal taxon which has been assigned to a species(group). This does not reflect a real taxonomic instance but allows to differentiate certain taxonomic and/or functional instances across analyses that do not rely on detailed taxonomy.

description.para: Nominal taxon

Nominal taxon which has been assigned to a species(group). This does not reflect a real taxonomic instance but allows to differentiate certain taxonomic and/or functional instances across analyses that do not rely on detailed taxonomy.
Higher taxonomic unit the (morpho)species or OTU belongs to. Moreover, detailed information on feeding preferences or similar are given.
